1.title: Be A Good Person
1.subtitle: Instead of supporting the current trends of negativity, our #1 goal is to remind us all to approach our days with an optimistic, positive, and refreshed outlook. We believe that positive change truly starts with within ourselves, one person at a time.

1.title: Kultured Misfits
1.subtitle: Kultured Misfits is a lifestyle, sport and ready-to-wear brand based out of Atlanta, Georgia. With a heavy influence from culture found in music, film, and art, we are driven to create timeless work by portraying an aesthetic that is uniquely our own to impact our everyday life.

products.name: Kultured Misfits Tracksuit (Crew + Joggers)

products.name: MISFIT Embossed Crewneck

2.title: Derek Chauvin Is Sentenced To 22 1/2 Years For George Floyd's Murder
2.subtitle: A Minnesota judge sentenced Derek Chauvin to 22 1/2 years in prison for the murder of George Floyd — a punishment that exceeds the state's minimum guidelines but falls short of prosecutors' request of a 30-year sentence.

2.title: 3 Drs. & A Plan
2.subtitle:
3 Drs. & A Plan was created out of the drive to help goal-driven educators pursue their dreams. You have a bright future ahead of you but you may not know the right steps to take or how to get started. With our trained life coaches and educational career advisors, we will help you set attainable goals and create the right plan to make your hopes and wishes come true. 

As a life coach and career consultant, we help teachers deal with issues on an individual basis and determine the proper strategy for their needs.

3.title: Color blind or color brave?
3.subtitle: The subject of race can be very touchy. As finance executive Mellody Hobson says, it's a "conversational third rail." But, she says, that's exactly why we need to start talking about it. In this engaging, persuasive talk, Hobson makes the case that speaking openly about race — and particularly about diversity in hiring — makes for better businesses and a better society.

4.title: Ruth Nathan's
4.subtitle: It is Nicole R. Brown's desire that Ruth Nathan’s does not only make customers look spectacular but feel spectacular as well, positively influencing them to feel better about themselves. It is a known fact that when one dresses well, one feels better—and from an outfit that is well put together, that makes one walk with pride, the Urban Peacock emerges.

products.name: Blue Curved Mask
products.description: Still want to look dapper while protecting yourself and others? We have the answer! Reusable and re-washable, these fabric masks will keep you looking good and doing good. When you buy a curved face mask from Ruth Nathan’s we donate a rectangular face mask to health care professionals and essential workers in need.

products.name: Franc Bleu Bow Tie
products.description: The deep older brother of the Franc Un pattern, the Franc Bleu’s watercolor pen lines convey elegance and a truly historic sense of style. Also inspired by French Polynesian currency, the Franc Bleu carries notes of art deco, dancing under the stars, and midnight.

products.name: Franc Un Pocket Square
products.description: Inspired by French Polynesian currency, the Franc Un pattern gives off a refined yet playful vibe sure to elevate your look during formal occasions. Perfect for when you want to be taken seriously—but not too seriously. Notes of Art Deco, French Quarter jazz, and pistachios.

6.title: Children's Books Starring Kids of Color
6.subtitle: Jambo Books is a children's book subscription company.  We send our members 2 or 3 books each month that feature a child of color as the star of a fiction story.
6.moreInfo:
Jambo Books serves children from birth to age 13. Our oldest members, ages 10-13, receive a middle grade novel and a nonfiction companion book that expands on a topic discussed in the novel. We focus on stories about children of color to delight your young readers and reaffirm your values of creating an inclusive and welcoming community.

Jambo means “Hello” in Swahili. Hello is an invitation to start a connection, to learn something new, to expand our notion of what it is to be human. Similarly, we invite our readers to build their own empathy muscles by reading about people who aren't exactly like themselves. Together, we affirm the humanity of every person.

6.title: Intersectionality Matters! Podcast
6.subtitle: Intersectionality Matters! is a podcast hosted by Kimberlé Crenshaw, an American civil rights advocate and a leading scholar of critical race theory.

7.title: Dr. Ernest Everett Just
7.subtitle: Dr. Ernest Just was a pioneering African American biologist, academic and science writer. Just's primary legacy is his recognition of the fundamental role of the cell surface in the development of organisms.

8.title: What Is Juneteenth?
8.subtitle: Juneteenth (short for “June Nineteenth”) marks the day when federal troops arrived in Galveston, Texas in 1865 to take control of the state and ensure that all enslaved people be freed. The troops’ arrival came a full two and a half years after the signing of the Emancipation Proclamation. Juneteenth honors the end to slavery in the United States and is considered the longest-running African American holiday.

11.title: Robert Tanner Freeman - Bytes of History
11.subtitle: Robert Tanner Freeman was born in Washington DC in 1846. He was the son of slaves who had bought their freedom in the 19th century. Historical records are unclear but they probably adopted the surname Freeman in response to their transition.

12.title: Stay Informed: Ma'Khia Bryant Shooting
12.subtitle: A teenage girl who the police say threatened two girls with a knife was fatally shot by an officer in Columbus, Ohio, on Tuesday, April 20th, 2021, shortly before a jury reached a guilty verdict in the murder trial of the former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin in last year’s killing of George Floyd.

12.title: What I am learning from my white grandchildren
12.subtitle: Are we in a post-racial society? Do we want to be? Anthony Peterson, an African American, draws from current research and from conversations with his Anglo American grandchildren to address truths about race in 21st century America.

13.title: The Pan-African Congresses, 1900-1945
13.subtitle: In the nearly half century between 1900 and 1945, various political leaders and intellectuals from Europe, North America, and Africa met six times to discuss colonial control of Africa and develop strategies for eventual African political liberation.

15.title: 22 Maps & Charts Explaining Mass Incarceration
15.subtitle: America is number one — in incarceration. Over the past several decades, the country has built the largest prison population in the entire world, with the second-highest prison population per capita behind the tiny African country of Seychelles. But how did it get this way?

16.title: The Honey Wine Company

products.name: Brut 750ml Honey Wine

17.title: All Hip-Hop
17.subtitle:
AllHipHop.com was founded and launched in 1998 by CEO’s "Grouchy" Greg Watkins and Chuck "Jigsaw" Creekmur.

After many years of developing the site, AllHipHop.com has become a valuable resource for hip-hop on the internet, featuring daily news, interviews, reviews, multimedia, a fast growing community and other interesting content.

Publications such as CNN, The Source, XXL, Complex, New York Post, The New York Times and many others cite AllHipHop.com’s news and features due to our accuracy and trustworthiness.

18.moreInfo: In this 90 minute workshop, coaches will have an interactive discussion on how to combat racial discrimination, champion moral courage and empower their programs to create positive change in their communities.

18.title: The Nile List

19.title: #ChooseToChallenge - International Women's Day
19.subtitle: A challenged world is an alert world. Individually, we're all responsible for our own thoughts and actions - all day, every day. We can all choose to challenge and call out gender bias and inequality. We can all choose to seek out and celebrate women's achievements. Collectively, we can all help create an inclusive world. From challenge comes change, so let's all choose to challenge.

21.title: John Hope - Biography
21.subtitle: John Hope was an important African American educator and race leader of the early twentieth century. In 1906 he became the first Black president of Morehouse College—the alma mater of Martin Luther King Jr.—in Atlanta.

products.name: "Juneteenth" - Unisex T

products.name: "Energy I Be On AKA Black Powered" - Unisex Long-Sleeved T
products.description: "Black Powered" T-Shirt - When I think about the greatness of us and all that we've been able to become DESPITE all that we've been through and STILL going through, one reason that is specific to us is, US.

24.title: Justice for the Murder of Rayshard Brooks
24.subtitle: Rayshard Brooks, an unarmed, 27 year old Black man was murdered after 3 officers responded to complaints of him sleeping in his vehicle in the Wendy’s parking lot. After struggling with the officers, Brooks began to run for his life, when he was shot in the back more than once.

25.title: Martin Luther King Jr.’s ‘Letter From Birmingham Jail’
25.subtitle: In April 1963, King was jailed in Birmingham, Alabama. While there, he wrote a lengthy letter in the margins of a newspaper, and smuggled it out with the help of his lawyer. The eloquent call for “constructive, nonviolent tension” to force an end to unjust laws became a landmark document of the civil-rights movement.

25.title: Book: The Global Beauty Industry

products.name: Combo 3 Pack

26.title: 210 Teas
26.subtitle:
Inspired by the 5 bags of black tea brewed  on my late grandmother’s stove, that were to later be stirred with sugar and offered to anyone that entered her kitchen, 210 Teas honors the subtle yet strong essence of my grandmother. For me, tea is a reminder of my family – a reminder of generational love. Tea provides a soothing sense of comfort that speaks without words, like the omnipresent protection of your ancestors.

The mission of 210 Teas is to share that comfort with everyone I can reach. From my cup … to yours, with love.

27.title: 3 ways to speak English
27.subtitle: Jamila Lyiscott is a "tri-tongued orator" in her powerful spoken-word essay "Broken English," she celebrates — and challenges — the three distinct flavors of English she speaks with her friends, in the classroom and with her parents. As she explores the complicated history and present-day identity that each language represents, she unpacks what it means to be "articulate."

products.description: Yummy Buddy is designed to engage vision, auditory and fine motor skills from infant to toddler and beyond. Bright, contrasting patterns will fascinate baby as eyesight develops, and they can discover new sounds, colors, and textures before. There’s a multi-purpose clip designed for strollers or diaper bags so it can travel with you. Exploring role play fun at home and on the go. Yummy Buddy has crinkly ears, both chewable "glow" silicone hands, teething bib, multiple colors, and chimes when shaken, too! The perfect sensory chew toy.
